A

acceptMessage(AMessage) - Method in class apryraz.eworld.EnvelopeWorldEnv
Process a message received by the EFinder agent, by returning an appropriate answer It should answer to moveto and detectsat messages
addLastFutureClausesToPastClauses() - Method in class apryraz.eworld.EnvelopeFinder
This function should add all the clauses stored in the list futureToPast to the formula stored in solver.
AMessage - Class in apryraz.eworld
Class for representing messages exchanged between agents and the World interface object
AMessage(String, String, String, String) - Constructor for class apryraz.eworld.AMessage
Class constructor
apryraz.eworld - package apryraz.eworld
This package contains an implementation of the Envelope World, where an agent has to find the location of the envelopes using the detector sensor to get information about the world.

B

buildGamma() - Method in class apryraz.eworld.EnvelopeFinder
This function builds the initial logical formula of the agent and stores it into the solver object.

C

coordToLineal(int, int, int) - Method in class apryraz.eworld.EnvelopeFinder
Convert a coordinate pair (x,y) to the integer value t_[x,y] of variable that stores that information in the formula, using offset as the initial index for that subset of position variables (past and future position variables have different variables, so different offset values)

D

DetectsAt() - Method in class apryraz.eworld.EnvelopeFinder
Send to the environment object the question: "Does the detector sense something around(agentX,agentY) ?"

E

EFState - Class in apryraz.eworld
 
EFState(int) - Constructor for class apryraz.eworld.EFState
 
EnvelopeFinder - Class in apryraz.eworld
This agent performs a sequence of movements, and after each movement it "senses" from the environment the resulting position and then the outcome from the smell sensor, to try to locate the position of Envelope
EnvelopeFinder(int) - Constructor for class apryraz.eworld.EnvelopeFinder
The class constructor must create the initial Boolean formula with the rules of the Envelope World, initialize the variables for indicating that we do not have yet any movements to perform, make the initial state.
EnvelopeWorld - Class in apryraz.eworld
The class for the main program of the Barcenas World

M

main(String[]) - Static method in class apryraz.eworld.EnvelopeWorld
This function loads 4 arguments from the command line:
moveTo(int, int) - Method in class apryraz.eworld.EnvelopeFinder
Use agent "actuators" to move to (x,y) We simulate this by telling to the World Agent (environment) that we want to move, but we need the answer from it to be sure that the movement was made with success
moveToNext() - Method in class apryraz.eworld.EnvelopeFinder
Ask the agent to move to the next position, by sending an appropriate message to the environment object.

P

performInferenceQuestions() - Method in class apryraz.eworld.EnvelopeFinder
This function should check, using the future variables related to possible positions of Envelope, whether it is a logical consequence that an envelope is NOT at certain positions.

R

runNextStep() - Method in class apryraz.eworld.EnvelopeFinder
Execute the next step in the sequence of steps of the agent, and then use the agent sensor to get information from the environment.
runStepsSequence(int, int, String, String) - Static method in class apryraz.eworld.EnvelopeWorld
This function should execute the sequence of steps stored in the file fileSteps, but only up to numSteps steps.
